Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to understand the normative process described and then compare each case in the event log against those rules

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with the normative process The process starts with Receive order The next step must be Check inventory Depending on the inventory check result two paths emerge If inventory is sufficient 1 Check Inventory Authorize Payment Package Items Ship Order Close Order If inventory is insufficient 1 Check Inventory Cancel Order Close Order

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Important constraints Authorize payment must come after Check inventory and before Package items Package items must come before Ship order Ship order cant occur after Cancel order Close order is always the last activity

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Activities in order Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close This follows the sufficient inventory path perfectly So no violation here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Sequence Receive Check Package Authorize Ship Close Wait here Authorize payment comes after Package items But the norm says authorize must be before packaging So thats a problem Also the order skips the authorization step before packaging which violates the rule So this case is deviating

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Activities Receive Check Authorize Cancel Ship Close Wait after Cancel Order they did Ship Order But the norm says after cancellation you cant do fulfillment steps like shipping So shipping after cancellation is a violation Also Authorize Payment before Cancel Hmm but if inventory was insufficient they shouldnt have authorized payment at all because the authorization should only happen if inventory is sufficient So the authorization here is also a problem because after checking inventory if its insufficient the next step should be Cancel not authorize Therefore both authorizing before cancel and shipping after cancel are issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Receive Check Cancel Close This follows the insufficient inventory path Looks fine No violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Ship Close Missing Package items between Authorize and Ship The norm requires Package after Authorize and before Ship So skipping package items and going directly to Ship is a violation Also Ship before Close Wait the norm says Close is last so Ship must come before Close which it does here but missing the package step is the main issue

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait let me double check each case again to make sure I didnt miss anything

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2 The issue is the order of Authorize and Package The norm says Authorize must come before Package Here they did Package then Authorize Thats definitely a violation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 The authorization before cancellation is an issue Because after checking inventory if theres not enough you should Cancel immediately The authorize step shouldnt happen in that path Also shipping after cancel is another violation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 5 Missing the package step between Authorize and Ship So thats a problem

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the violating cases are 2 3 and 5 Case 4 is okay

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait let me check the norm again Once the payment is authorized the items should be prepared for shipmentthis is commonly referred to as Package items Only after items have been properly packaged is it appropriate to proceed with Ship order So the correct order is Authorize Package Ship Case 5 skips packaging so thats a violation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 also has a problem in that after checking inventory they first authorize which shouldnt happen if inventory was insufficient Because if inventory is insufficient after Check they should Cancel not do anything else except Cancel and Close So the authorize step here is wrong because inventory was insufficient so they shouldnt have authorized payment So thats another violation in Case 3

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay so summarizing Violations in each case Case 2 Package before Authorize wrong order Authorization after packaging violates the required order Case 3 Authorized payment even though inventory was insufficient since they ended up canceling implying insufficient Then proceeded to Ship after Cancel invalid So two violations here Case 5 Skipped packaging between Authorize and Ship violates sequence Case 1 and 4 are okay

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I need to structure this clearly referencing each cases violations against the norms constraints
